title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that transportation technology is part of the cultural landscape shown in Image 2.

Two points for explaining how specific technologies contribute to the cultural landscape shown in Image 2.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways technology contributes to the cultural landscape shown in Image 2:
The response correctly states the following way technology contributes to the cultural landscape shown in Image 2:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways technology contributes to the cultural landscape shown in Image 2:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for describing one way that urbanization may produce new forms of cultural ideas and practices.

Two points for describing two ways that urbanization may produce new forms of cultural ideas and practices.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following ways that urbanization may produce new forms of cultural ideas and practices:
The response correctly describes one of the following ways that urbanization may produce new forms of cultural ideas and practices:
The response correctly describes two of the following ways that urbanization may produce new forms of cultural ideas and practices:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the images fail to show the processes by which colonialism spread cultural patterns and practices.

Two points for explaining a specific example of a process or underlying relationship that is not illustrated by the images.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following limitations of using the images to understand how colonialism spread cultural patterns and practices:
The response correctly states the following limitation of using the images to understand how colonialism spread cultural patterns and practices:
The response correctly explains one of the following limitations of using the images to understand how colonialism spread cultural patterns and practices:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for describing the concept of placemaking without explaining this concept to shared public spaces.

Two points for explaining an explicit link between urban placemaking, quality of life, and shared public spaces.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that shared public spaces relate to the concept of placemaking:
The response correctly describes the concept of placemaking:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that shared public spaces relate to the concept of placemaking:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that cultural landscapes may or may not correspond to or align with political boundaries at any scale.

Two points for explaining a specific reason how cultural landscapes do or do not align with political boundaries at any scale.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following degrees to which features in a cultural landscape relate to a country’s political boundaries:
The response correctly states the following degree to which features in a cultural landscape relate to a country’s political boundaries:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which features in a cultural landscape relate to a country’s political boundaries:
